Transcription for 1302561

What, when my heart, and man with sorrow, I know not what I am saying, nor what I am
doing, yet I must face it, courage my heart, the power of the man, the power of the jester,
the power of the man, the power of the jester,
The people pay thee, and wonder if you know,
who hark, when thy columbine hath strobe,
The heart's in error, and the world will cry, bravo!
For I will after thy tears and thy sorrow, sing and be merry, playing thy tarpaulin,
and the world will cry, bravo!
For I will after thy tears and thy sorrow, sing and be merry, playing thy tarpaulin, and the world will cry, bravo!
